class BtController

Detailed Description

When Bluetooth is instructed to do some operation that goes over the air these operations take at least a couple of time. Such operations are called a request for an operation because the function does not execute the operation. Instead of this the function asks the Bluetooth Stack for the exectution of the operation.
To avoid the running application from blocking while it is waiting for the end of the execution of a requested operation, requests where executed in a asynchronous way. When the Bluetooth Stack has finished a requested operation, it calls a callback function associated with the requested operation. Depending on the profile the relevant Bt...Controller implements this callback function. From within these functions messages were sent to the running application to notify it about the progress and success of the requested operation.
BtRequest is the base class for such requests as described above. To enable the reception of messages BtRequest is derived from UserDispatcher. This class is abstract because it primarily defines the interface to all requests. The execution of a certain operation is implemented by the apropriate Bt...Request class. This is done by calling the corresponding function in one Bt...Controller class that instructs the Bluetooth Stack to execute the requested operation.
Some of the operation requested from the Bluetooth Stack can be interrupted. These request are called cancelable. If a request is cancelable the procedure to cancel an initiated request must be implemented too. The last step of implementing a concrete reqeuest is to implement the On... function to dispatch and handle the messages sent to the application by the apropriate Bt...Controller class.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN BtRequest::CanCancelRequest (   )  const [virtual]
 

Can this request be cancelled?

Checks if the request is ready for being cancelled. This means that this request has to be in certain states.

Returns:
TRUE: This request is ready for being cancelled.
FALSE: This request is not ready for being cancelled.

virtual BOOLEAN BtRequest::Cancel (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Set controller parameters and call stack to cancel operation.

The Cancel member function is responsible for setting the appropriate parameters and perform the call to the controllers function, that cancels an ongoing operation at the Bluetooth Stack. This function is pure virtual because each request is canceled in a different way and this has to be implemented by the concrete Bt...Request class.

Returns:
TRUE: The setup of the stack parameters was successfull and the Bluetooth stack accepted the requested operation.
FALSE: Either the setup of the stack parameters failed or the Bluetooth stack rejected the requested operation.

Implemented in BtDeviceSearchRequest, BtServiceRequest, BtServiceVerifyRequest, and BtUncancelableRequest.

BtRequestState BtRequest::CancelRequest (   ) 
 

Stop the exection of this request.

CancelRequest is used to stop this ongoing request. If this request is cancelable this function must be implemented in the class that realizes this request. If this request is not cancelable this concrete request is derived from BtUncancelableRequest where this function is implemented to return only the current state of execution.

Returns:
A BtRequestState containing the current state of exectuion for this request. If this request is not cancelable the request state will not change and this not changed request state is returned. Otherwise the state will change and this changed state will be returned.

BOOLEAN BtRequest::CanExecuteRequest (   )  const [virtual]
 

Can this request be exectued?

Checks if the request is ready for being executed. This means that this request has to be in certain states.

Returns:
TRUE: This request is ready for being executed.
FALSE: This request is not ready for being executed.

BtRequestState BtRequest::ChangeRequestState (  BOOLEAN  success  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Sets the new state depending on the success.

ChangeRequestState is a function that is used by the ExecuteRequest and the EvaluateMessageResult functions to do the change of the request state. Depending on the current state and the passed in success, this function sets the right new state. The passed in success parameter can be on the one hand the result of a function call, on the other hand the result parameter of a message sent up to the request by the apropriate controller.

Parameters:
success A BOOLEAN indicating the success of the operation execution stage corresponding to the current state.
Returns:
A BtRequestState containing the new request state after doing the state transition.

Reimplemented in BtAvrcpRequest, BtBppReq, BtBppSndAbortReqRequest, BtBppSndFilePushReqRequest, BtRequestRespondRequest, and BtObexRequest.

BtRequestState BtRequest::ChangeRequestStateForCancel (  BOOLEAN  success  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Set the new state for a cancel operation depending on the success.

ChangeRequestStateForCancel is a function that is used by the CancelRequest function to do the change of the request state. Depending on the current state and the passed in success, this function sets the right new state. The passed in success parameter is the result of a stack function call.

Parameters:
success A BOOLEAN indicating the success of the operation execution stage corresponding to the current state.
Returns:
A BtRequestState containing the new request state after doing the state transition.

BOOLEAN BtRequest::EvaluateExecutionResult (  BtResultCode  result  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Reimplemented in BtBppReq, and BtObexRequest.

virtual BOOLEAN BtRequest::Execute (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Set controller parameters and call controller function.

The Execute member function is responsible for setting the appropriate parameters and perform the call to the controllers function, that executes the requested operation at the Bluetooth Stack. This function is pure virtual because each request is exectued in a different way and this has to be implemented by the concrete Bt...Request class.

Returns:
TRUE: The setup of the stack parameters was successfull and the Bluetooth stack accepted the requested operation.
FALSE: Either the setup of the stack parameters failed or the Bluetooth stack rejected the requested operation.

Implemented in BtAvrcpConnectResponse, BtAvrcpDeRegisterRequest, BtAvrcpOperationRequestResponse, BtAvrcpPanelPassThroughRequest, BtAvrcpRawFrameRequest, BtAvrcpRegisterRequest, BtAvrcpSubunitInfoRequest, BtAvrcpUnitInfoRequest, BtBppSndAbortReqRequest, BtBppSndFilePushReqRequest, BtBppSndGetRefObjRspRequest, BtConnectRequest, BtDevicePairRequest, BtDeviceSearchRequest, BtDeviceTrustRequest, BtDeviceUnpairRequest, BtDeviceUntrustRequest, BtDisconnectRequest, BtQuerySupportedProfilesRequest, BtRespondAuthorizationRequest, BtSendPasskeyRequest, BtServiceVerifyRequest, BtSetRemoteDeviceNameRequest, BtObexAbortRequest, BtObexConnectRequest, BtObexDisconnectRequest, BtObexGetRequest, BtObexPutRequest, BtObexRegisterClientRequest, BtObexRegisterServerRequest, BtObexSetPathRequest, BtObexUnregisterClientRequest, and BtObexUnregisterServerRequest.

virtual BtRequestState BtRequest::ExecuteRequest (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Sumbit this request to the Bluetooth Stack.

ExecuteRequest instructs this request to sent itself to the Bluetooth stack for execution purposes. This function prepares the submission of the request to the stack. The real exection of the stack call is done by the fuction Execute, which is a pure virtual function, that has to be overwritten by the concrete request, which is a subclass of this class.

Returns:
A BtRequestState containing the current state of exectuion for this request. Most times the returned state indicates whether the Bluetooth Stack has accepted or rejected the request.

Implemented in BtLocalRequest, and BtServiceRequest.

virtual void BtRequest::ExecutionCallback (  BtResultCode  result  )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Implemented in BtBppSndAbortReqRequest, BtBppSndFilePushReqRequest, BtBppSndGetRefObjRspRequest, BtLocalRequest, BtServiceRequest, BtObexAbortRequest, BtObexConnectRequest, BtObexDisconnectRequest, BtObexGetRequest, BtObexPutRequest, BtObexRegisterClientRequest, BtObexRegisterServerRequest, BtObexSetPathRequest, BtObexUnregisterClientRequest, and BtObexUnregisterServerRequest.

UINT32 BtRequest::GetRequestId (   )  const
 

Gets the unique id for this request.

GetRequestId returns a unique id for each request instantiated by any application.

Returns:
A UINT32 containing the unique id for this request.

BtRequestState BtRequest::GetRequestState (   )  const
 

Get processing state of this request.

A request can be seen as it goes through several stages in its execution process. Because all requests execute asynchronously there must be a possibility to query the stage of execution in which the request currently is. GetRequestState is the function that realizes this needs.

Returns:
A BtRequestState containing the current stage of execution of this request.

virtual BtRequestType BtRequest::GetRequestType (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Get type of this request.

The runtime type information feature is not supported by all compilers which this framework is used with. So a rudimentary type information system is implemnted by this class. Each type of request that has no subtypes (leaf class) must return an unique type identifier. GetRuestType return this type idenifier which is implemented as an enumeration type.

Returns:
A BtRequestType containing the type that describes this request.

Implemented in BtAvrcpConnectResponse, BtAvrcpDeRegisterRequest, BtAvrcpOperationRequestResponse, BtAvrcpPanelPassThroughRequest, BtAvrcpRawFrameRequest, BtAvrcpRegisterRequest, BtAvrcpSubunitInfoRequest, BtAvrcpUnitInfoRequest, BtBppSndAbortReqRequest, BtBppSndFilePushReqRequest, BtBppSndGetRefObjRspRequest, BtDevicePairRequest, BtDeviceSearchRequest, BtDeviceTrustRequest, BtDeviceUnpairRequest, BtDeviceUntrustRequest, BtQuerySupportedProfilesRequest, BtRespondAuthorizationRequest, BtSendPasskeyRequest, BtServiceVerifyRequest, BtSetRemoteDeviceNameRequest, BtObexAbortRequest, BtObexConnectRequest, BtObexDisconnectRequest, BtObexGetRequest, BtObexPutRequest, BtObexRegisterClientRequest, BtObexRegisterServerRequest, BtObexSetPathRequest, BtObexUnregisterClientRequest, and BtObexUnregisterServerRequest.

virtual BOOLEAN BtRequest::IsCancelable (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Is this kind of request cancelable?

So kinds of requests have a very long duration. Most of these requests can be interrupted. Other request once submitted can not be stopped. So IsCancelable returns whether a request can be canceled or not. This function is pure virtual because it depends on the kind of request if it is cancelable. Further there are two subclasses which implement this function and the concrete request should be derived from one of these classes.

Returns:
TRUE: This request can be canceled.
FALSE: This request can not be canceled.

Implemented in BtCancelableRequest, BtServiceRequest, and BtUncancelableRequest.

void BtRequest::ResetRequestState (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

virtual void BtRequest::SetRequestState (  BtRequestState  request_state  )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Set processing state of this request.

A request can be seen as it goes through several stages in its execution process. SetRequestState can be used to set the current stage of execution. When the passed in state is other than the current state the OnRequestStateChange callback function will be invoked.

Parameters:
request_state A BtRequestState containing the current stage of exection which has to be set for this request.

Implemented in BtBppReq, BtBppSndAbortReqRequest, BtBppSndFilePushReqRequest, BtLocalRequest, and BtServiceRequest.
